snippet: In a long televised speech, the rebel leader Abdel-Malik al-Houthi gave no indication he was willing to negotiate with Saudi Arabia or to agree to their conditions for a cease-fire.
abstract: Abdel-Malik al-Houthi, leader of Yemen's Houthi rebels, delivers defiant address on Houthi news channel in which he gives no indication that he is considering cease-fire with Saudis, more than three weeks after Saudi Arabia began bombing campaign in Yemen; Houthi's stance makes possibility of prolonged war more likely and raises concerns about Saudi military strategy.

byline.original: By MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Mohammed Ali Kalfood reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Djibouti.

lead_paragraph: In a long televised speech, the rebel leader Abdel-Malik al-Houthi gave no indication he was willing to negotiate with Saudi Arabia or to agree to their conditions for a cease-fire.

headline.main: Yemen Houthi Leader Is Defiant in Face of Saudi Airstrikes
headline.print_headline: Houthi Leader Is Defiant in Face of Saudi Airstrikes
